intro: Friesodielsia discostigma, commonly known as the African violet, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical Africa. It features upright stems with opposite, ovate to elliptic leaves that are often hairy and have a waxy surface. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white, typically arranged in clusters at the top of the stem. Its roots are fibrous and adapted to retain moisture in its natural habitat. Friesodielsia discostigma is widely cultivated as a ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms.
